fear the name of the Lord…and his glory/the west/the rising of the sun. Those who receive God's judgments will be afraid of both death and eternal punishment, and they will fear the Lord who brings both. When the Lord comes in his glory, "every knee shall bow, and every tongue shall confess,…saying: Fear God, and give glory to him" (D&C 88:104). These responses will occur from the west to the east, over the entire globe (40:5; 52:10).

like a flood. The enemies of the Lord's people will come with such power and in such numbers that they cannot be stopped or turned (8:6-8). But the Lord will stop them nonetheless.

a standard against him. Just as the Lord will lift a banner or ensign as a rallying point for the righteous, so will he lift a banner or ensign as a rallying point in the battle against evil (49:22; Alma 46:11-21, 36; 62:4).
